name: (2-amino-3,5-dimethylphenyl)(phenyl)methanol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2762
Reason: 2-Amino-3,5-dimethylphenyl and phenyl groups can contribute to the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The methyl groups can also contribute to the melting point due to their ability to increase the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure, approximately +10°C each. The amino group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which can raise the melting point by approximately +10°C.
